subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
lead_paragraph: The Paris-Nice race is set to start Sunday even though teams that participate face sanctions from cycling’s governing body, the International Cycling Union, which says it is fighting for its ability to regulate the doping-marred sport.Pat McQuaid, the president of the cycling union, has urged riders to boycott the Paris-Nice race, the season’s first major stage race, calling it “illegal” because the race organizer, the Amaury Sport Organization, is holding it under French laws and outside U.C.I. rules.McQuaid has threatened teams with six-month suspensions, fines of up to $9,700 and bans from the track world championships this month, which would affect cyclists who are trying to qualify for the Beijing Olympics.But the International Association of Professional Cyclists ruled in favor of starting the race.
